subtasks: Entering the combine harvester
Starting the combine harvester's engine
Adjusting combine harvester settings for different crops
Navigating the combine harvester through the field
Operating the combine harvester's harvesting mechanism
Ensuring proper grain flow through the combine harvester
Overseeing grain grading and quality during harvest
Managing combine harvester speed to optimize harvesting efficiency
Checking for and resolving issues during the harvest
Taking samples of harvested grain
Using a moisture meter to test samples
Recording moisture levels and adjusting harvesting according to results
Ensuring grain is of acceptable quality for storage
Deciding on additional drying steps if moisture levels are too high

tasks.task: Performing routine maintenance on the combine harvester
subtasks: Inspecting the combine harvester's components for wear
Performing oil changes and refills
Checking and replacing belts, filters, and other consumables
Cleaning the combine harvester's deck plate and augers
Ensuring all seals and gaskets are intact and free from leaks
Tightening loose bolts and securing any moving parts
Testing the combine harvester's electrical systems
Reaching under the combine harvester to check or replace parts

tasks.task: Planting malting barley with a grain drill
subtasks: Loading the grain drill with malting barley seed
Setting the grain drill's depth and seed spacing
Adjusting the grain drill's down pressure wheels
Entering the field to plant the malting barley
Driving the grain drill in a straight line for consistent planting
Monitoring the grain drill's operation and making adjustments as needed
Ensuring proper seed coverage and fertilizer placement
Checking the grain drill's seed metering mechanism
Timing seed drops evenly
Ensuring correct opener clearance and seed depth for optimal germination
Adjusting down pressure to prevent downforce variations
Managing row markers to ensure even seed distribution
Monitoring and maintaining the grain drill's seed and fertilizer hoppers

tasks.task: Adjusting the grain drill's down pressure
subtasks: Determining appropriate down pressure for different soil conditions

Checking for proper ground contact and seed placement
Ensuring optimal soil-to-seed contact for germination
